"Hey, Yuten. Mind if we talk for a minute?" Misty asks. "Alone?"

"Sure, if neither of you mind, that is." You tell her before turning back to Ren and Akiza.

"Go for it. I'll be fine." Akiza says.

"Sure. I suppose it's my turn to watch over her next, anyway." Ren admits.

"Thank you both." Misty says as she leads you out into the hall and a little bit away from the room.

"What's up Misty?" You ask her.

"Well, a few things, to be honest. On a smaller note, Toby says he's not able to come by to check out the new movement any time soon. My parents don't want him down here while the city is like this." She explains.

"Understandable, I wouldn't want to risk sending a kid down into this mess either." You state.

"I'm glad you understand. He says he's sorry he couldn't make it but looks forward to when he's finally allowed to come." She finishes.

"Okay. That's one thing. What's next?" You ask.

"Well, it's about Akiza and that fortune I gave her before. Did she tell you about it?" She asks.

"Yeah, something about needing strength and kindness to unlock that card of hers, right?" You say.

"Correct. Well, she asked me to try again today while you were gone." She begins.

"And...?" You lead on.

"When I looked into her eyes to see her fortune about the card, I saw something... different." She says.

"Different how?" You ask.

"Before, I merely saw signs of needing those virtues to find her truth. This time though? Her eyes were clear, and in them I saw a vision. One of a great queen, beloved by her subjects. In peace, she sat atop her throne, benevolent and kind to her people. In battle, when her allies were threatened, she fought with the strength and tenacity of a tiger." She explains.

"That sounds like her, alright." You say. "So why tell me this and not her?"

"Because. In the vision, the queen had a pet dragon by her side, one she loved more than anything else in the world. Then, darkness spread over the queen's kingdom. Her dragon rushed out to battle the darkness, but soon found itself outmatched and facing destruction. The queen ran out, weapon in hand to protect the beast and... the vision ended." She wraps up.

"And you got all that just from looking into her eyes?" You ask.

"I can't explain it myself, perhaps it is her signer powers mixed with my fortune telling abilities, I don't know. But do you see now why I have not yet told her?" She asks.

"You're worried that she'll take it as me dying to these Emperors of Iliyaster, right?" You ask.

"Correct. How should I proceed? I've held her off by saying that it was the same as before, but I'm sure she'll ask again soon. What should I do?" She asks.

1311111111111111111111112111211221111111.content:
You woke up to a pressure sitting on your chest. Your eyes slowly open to see Akiza sitting atop you, still in her nightwear. "Yuten, look!" She exclaims, moving her arm all around without any wincing or flinches. "I'm all healed."

"That's great to hear." You groggily say as you rub the sleep from your eyes. They soon snap open, though, as you feel Akiza's lips pressed against yours for a passionate kiss.

"And that was for taking such good care of me." She says with a wink.

"Call it part of my responsibilities to keep watch on you." You reply. "Maybe I should see if I can get paid to watch you."

Akiza gains a slight smirk at that comment. "Well then if we're doing that, then I think you owe me for how often I watch your back, like when I had to save you from those duel bots with a broken arm." She retorts.

"How about I give you a kiss good morning and we call it even?" You offer.

"Deal." She says as you pull her head in for a peck on her lips. "There, now we're even."

"So what's your plan for today?" You ask as you see her already going to get dressed.

"I'm going to go around and let the others know that I'm recovered. Ren, Misty, our parents, the students and so on. I figure they must all be worried about me, so it'd be good to put their minds at ease." She explains. "What about you?"

You decided to go to mess hall first. Everyone must be there eating breakfast right now. So it’ll be a good start. You made it there and you see Ren and your parents along with the students eating together.

“Hey. There you two are. How are you feeling Akiza?” Ren wondered.

You and the other eat together before finishing at letting the students know too. Everyone was happy to hear Akiza’s back to good health before you left with her.

1311111111111111111111112111211221111111.title: Let Everyone Know Of Akiza’s Recovery

1311111111111111111111112111211221111111.content:
"Come on. I'm sure your parents would like to know that you're back on your feet." You tell Akiza as you head down to the garage.

"Sounds good. I've been itching to get back out there after laying around all day." She says with fire in her eyes.

"Easy there. We're not looking for a fight. Just a simple drive to your parents' place." You remind her.

"Cut me some slack. I've been ready to laying in a bed almost non-stop for a while. I'm just excited to move free again." She whines.

"Just don't go too overboard with moving free. We don't need you getting hurt right after you just finished healing." You say as you enter the garage. "Sion, two runners please." You call out, getting the mechanic's attention.

"Right away, sir. Oh, Miss Akiza. I see you're up and about once more." He says.

"Yup, ready to ride again." She says with a cheerful smile.

"Very well then. I'll have both your runners out and ready for you ASAP." He says as he leads you down to where your runners awaited you.

"So Sion, I gotta ask. Before, we could barely afford mine and Ren's runners. How did you get so many for the students to use the other night?" You ask.

"You can thank Miss Tredwell for that. When she agreed to sponsor us in the tournament, a lot of extra funds came our way. I was able to put together a few more runners for the students after that." He explains.

"Well that was nice of her." Akiza says as she sits down on her runner once more. "You ready?"

"You know it." You reply as you rev up your own engine as you both pull out of the garage and into the streets. You can see a look of sadness on her face as she sees the damage to the city in person after the attack. Even with everyone working night and day to fix it, it was still far from all fixed like her arm.

*****

Finally, you pull up in front of her parents' house, where she wastes no time running up to the door and ringing the bell, with you coming up from behind. Akiza's mother answered the door, and you could see the shock on her face. "Akiza! You're all better." She says with cheer as she hugs her daughter. "Honey, come look. Akiza's back on her feet." She calls inside.

"Really?" You hear her father say as he runs to the door. "Akiza!" He says as he joins the hug."

"Okay guys, my arm may be healed, but I can still break. Too tight." Akiza says as her parents begin to squeeze too hard.

"Sorry." Her dad says as they release her. "We were just so happy to see that you aren't hurt any more."

"Don't worry. I took good care of her." You say as you remind them you were there.

"I'm sure you did." Her mother says with a smile.

"So how's things going with the reconstruction?" You ask her father.

"It's slow, but we're making progress. We just finished fixing the main highway out of the city last night, as well as the Daedalus Bridge connecting us to the Satellite. Now we're working on restoring the main roads and duel lanes so the tournament can resume." He explains.

"Shouldn't you guys be more focused on making sure people can live their lives like normal again before caring about some tournament?" You ask.

"Yes, but it will take some time to repair everything. In the meantime, though, this competition gets peoples' spirits up as it takes their attention away from the gloomy state of things outside. It's not perfect, but it's what we have." He answers.

"I see..." You muse.

"Well, we should go. You're busy and we still have to talk to a few other people." Akiza says as she starts walking back to the bikes. "Goodbye." She yells back.

You wave her parents goodbye as you pull away. "Okay Akiza, who next?" You ask.
1311111111111111111111112111211221111111.title: Akiza’s parents

1311111111111111111111112111211221111111.content:
“How about we go see Yusei, Jack, and Crow next? I’m sure they’ll be very thrilled to see me up and about again.” Akiza suggested.

“Okay. Last one there has to buy lunch.” You said as you drove off quickly.

“Hey!” Akiza said as she was driving as fast you are. “No fair! You got a head start!” Akiza complained.

“You did it to me on the last race. Of course it’s fair.” You said back to her.

“Hmph!” Akiza shrugged.

******

You two finally made it to the Satellite and you both pulled over at Team 5ds place.

“Ha! I win! That means your paying for lunch.” Akiza said victorious.

“Sure thing. Now let’s go see them.” You said getting off you runner.

You knocked on the door and Yusei comes in to see you once he answered the door.

“Hey, guys. I see you’re up and about again, Akiza.” Yusei said.

“You better believe it.” Akiza said as Yusei let you two in.

“Hey Hey Hey. Looks like little miss rose is back in full blossom.” Crow said see you two coming in.

“Good to be back too, Crow.” Akiza said.

“It’s good to see you in full health. We wouldn’t want that injury be a problem coming into the next part of the tournament.” Jack said.

“You can say that again, Jack.” You said before turning to Yusei. “So, Yusei? You found anything about those emperors from the other day?” You asked him.

“No. It seems these guys are good at keeping themselves secret from the public. And until we can get some kind of proof or a lead, Trudge can’t do a investigation. That means we might be on our own.” Yusei said.

“Bummer.” You sighed.

“Well, as long as we keep our heads up and believe hard enough, we can put these guys in their place.” Akiza said with passion and you and the boys nodded.

“Well, we should head out now. There’s still people she wants to see.” You said.

“Sure.” Yusei said.

“And Jack? See you at the finals.” You said as you let out your fist for him to bump.

“You better be there or else.” Jack said as he fist bumped you.

You both got on your runners and drove off to see Misty next.
1311111111111111111111112111211221111111.title: Team 5Ds

"This the place?" You ask as you pull in to a fancy-looking apartment building.

"This is the address Misty told me." Akiza replied as you dismounted and walked in. You see a rather stern-looking woman at the front desk. "Hi. We're here to see Misty."

"See?" Akiza asks as she once more demonstrates her painless free movement.

"That's wonderful to hear." She says with a smile. "Now let's see if you can stay on the bike in the next duel." She jokes, getting a laugh from both of you.

"Oh, by the way Misty. Sion told us about how it was thanks to you we were able to afford all those new duel runners the students used two nights ago. I just wanted to say thanks in person." You tell her.

"It was nothing. Whatever it takes to see your dream fulfilled and my brother happy." She says.

"Alright Miss Izinski, we've now told everyone we know that you're all better. So unless you want to hunt down Trudge and Mina to tell them, I think we're done here. So what now?" You ask.
1311111111111111111111112111211221111111.title: Seeing Misty

“Well, if you’re not doing anything, Misty, how about you join us?” Akiza offered.

“Of course. I’m free today.” Misty said.

“In that case, let’s get moving.” You said.

Misty was riding with Akiza as you all go to a nice little restaurant for lunch. You went inside and got your seats before taking your order.

“Well, when I first saw him that day, I felt my heart getting warm. When I looked into his eyes, I saw the purest soul I’ve ever seen. Somehow, I knew he was the one for me. When we started dating, I didn’t know what to expect considering I never dated before.” Misty said.

“He’s very lucky to have you in his life. I told him he should hold on to you because you’re a great woman.” You said.

“I bet he’ll go smothering me with his hugs.” Misty joked a little.

1311111111111111111111112111211221111111.title: After lunch

1311111111111111111111112111211221111111.content:
You see Ren back at headquarters as you went right inside.

“Hey, bro!” You called out to Ren.

“Hey, Yuten. Where’s Akiza?” Ren wondered.

“She’s with Misty. We’re on our way to the beach and I was wondering if you would like to join us.” You said.

“Sure. I have nothing planned now.” Ren said.

“Great. Grab some swim trunks and I’ll meet you outside.” You said before going to your room.

You grabbed everything you needed before meeting Ren back outside. You both drove off to the beach where you see Akiza already in her red bikini.

“Glad you could finally show up.” Akiza said playfully.

“Sorry. Bumpy roads and all. Where’s Misty?” You wondered.

“Over here.” Misty said in the back ground.

You all see her wearing a black-colored bikini and it got Ren fully mesmerized with joy at her beauty.

“What do you think?” Misty said while giggling at Ren’s reaction.

He almost passed out before he was able to keep himself standing.

“You look...... completely stunning.” Ren said in awe.

“Why thank you.” Misty said before kissing him on the lips.

You and Ren changed into your swim trunks before meeting back with your girlfriends.

“So, what should we do first?” Ren wondered.
1311111111111111111111112111211221111111.title: Another Double Date

choices: You all head back to Akiza's runner to grab dinner
They decide to head in the water
1311111111111111111111112111211221111111.content:
"Let's start with a nice walk. Take the scenery in a bit while we get our legs moving." You suggest.

"That sounds great. We can show them around a bit." Akiza adds.

"Oh? You've been here before?" Ren asks.

"You kidding? This place has been like a second home to me." You tell them as you begin walking. "Before I met Akiza or even had an apartment to call my own, I had this place. Nice and quiet, no people to worry about my powers going crazy, good place to practice. It was great."

"And yet you chose to rebuild Arcadia back where it was as opposed to free beachfront property." Ren jokes.

"It's not like I owned this place in any legal sense. It was just a nice, private beach where I could come chill out whenever I got stressed." You answer.

"It's amazing to see such a... pure sight." Misty speaks up. "No city to be seen, no roads, just beach."

"Well, there is a town within walking distance, but they almost never come here." You explain.

"Then I guess that's where we're getting dinner?" Ren asks.

"When the time comes, me and Misty prepared a picnic basket of food for dinner back at my runner." Akiza says.

"Nice." He cheers. You all continue to walk down the sand for about an hour or so as you continued to talk.

What happens next?
1311111111111111111111112111211221111111.title: Walking Around

1311111111111111111111112111211221111111.content:
“Now that we shown you the scenery, ready to head into the water?” You asked.

“Sounds like fun.” Ren said as the girls agreed.

You all go into the ocean and started splashing at each other. It feels really good that you all are having a fun time together as you swim around.

“Having a good time guys?” You asked them.

“We are. Coming here is always one of my favorite places to be.” Akiza said.

“I’ll say. I can see why you come here to get some peace and quiet. How about you Misty?” Ren asked, only she’s nowhere to be seen. “Misty? Where did she go?” Ren wondered looking all over for her.

“3,2,1.” You counted down quietly.

“Gotcha!” Misty jumped out of the water and grabbed on to Ren that scared him a little.

“My gosh, Misty! I thought you were a shark for a minute.” Ren said to Misty while she was holding on to her boyfriend.

“I thought it would be funny just to scare you a little.” Misty said before kissing him.

“It’s okay, bro. Akiza here did the same thing to me before.” You said.

“And it was funny to me too.” Akiza said before kissing you.

After a while, you all got out of the water and dried off.
1311111111111111111111112111211221111111.title: Ocean Fun

1311111111111111111111112111211221111111.content:
"I'm thinking it's about time we eat, wouldn't you guys agree?" You ask.

"Yeah. I'm getting hungry." Ren agrees as he pats his stomach in hunger.

"Alright. I'll go get the food." Akiza says as she heads up the beach and back onto the trail leading to your runners.

"So Yuten, I've been meaning to ask." Misty speaks up once she's out of earshot.

"What's up?" You question.

"Well, to my understanding you plan to propose to Akiza from the winner's circle of the WRGP. But what happens if you don't win? Then how will you propose to her?" She asks.

"You say that like we won't win." You joke.

"I'm serious. It's a major part of your plan relying on the outcome of this tournament." She says, staying firm.

"Well, I guess on the off chance that does happen, then I guess I'll have to wing it." You admit. "Maybe I'll do something here."

"Hey, come on guys." Ren steps in. "Let's not think like that. We're gonna win and you're gonna propose to her in front of everyone."

"Right." You and Misty agree.

"Food's here." Akiza calls out as she comes back with a basket full of food in her hand.

"Alright. Let's eat." You say as you all rush over and help her unpack as you lay out a blanket and begin to dig in.
1311111111111111111111112111211221111111.title: Time to Eat

1311111111111111111111112111211221111111.content:
You all sat on the blanket and began eating dinner together. It was a beautiful sight to behold as you all watched the sunset.

“I have to hand it to ya, bro. This is definitely a picture that’s worth more than a thousand words.” Ren complimented while watching the sunset.

“It definitely is, man. So, I’ve been wondering. When this tournament is all said and done, what are you going to do?” You wondered.

“Well, besides helping mom and dad get settled back home safe and sound, I’m not entirely sure.” Ren said.

“I’m sure something will pop up eventually.” Misty said as you all kept eating.

“I agree. For now, let’s all just focus on getting stronger for before the the tournament resumes.” Akiza said.

“That’s the plan. But let’s just enjoy the free time while we can.” You said as you finished your meals and watched the sun go down.
1311111111111111111111112111211221111111.title: A Sunset Dinner

1311111111111111111111112111211221111111.content:
You all packed up the basket and got dressed before heading back to your runners, with Misty taking it upon herself to carry the basket back. As you near the parking lot, you see something that sends a chill down your spine. It looked just like one of the Ghost bots sitting idle in the lot, waiting. Only... this one seemed different.

It was covered in some kind of muck and dirt. The runner part was looking in bad shape, but was still running fine. The visor on his helmet was partially broken, showing one of his robotic eyes. Overall, this one looked like it drove right out of the trash.

"Yuten Anjiou. I've been looking for you." It says in a distorted voice with a smug grin.

"That's impossible. I thought all the duel bots were destroyed after the attack on the city." You say.

"I wouldn't know. I never took part in that." The bot says. "I was deemed 'defective' by Master Primo before my fellow duel bots ever left the factory. As such, I was discarded. Only recently was I reactivated, and told that if I destroyed you, then I would return to Master Primo's favor."

"That's insane. Those Emperor guys said they were gonna settle this at the tournament, but now they're sending a duel bot assassin after my bro?" Ren asks.

"I am unsure who awakened me. But I do know this. What they said is true. By destroying Yuten, I will no longer be seen as defective by Master Primo. He will see that I was the one truly worthy to serve him." The bot rants.

"But wait, if the Emperors didn't awaken you, then who did?" Misty asks.

"It does not matter. I have been granted a second chance and I shall not waste it. Face me Yuten, and be destroyed." He announces.

"Alright you scrap heap reject. You're o.." You start only to be interrupted.

"Not a chance, this one's mine." ____ says.
1311111111111111111111112111211221111111.title: An Unexpected Intrusion

1311111111111111111111112111211221111111.content:
“Akiza? Are you sure?” You asked your girlfriend.

“I’m sure. If he wants to come and kill you, he’ll have to answer to me.” Akiza said not backing down.

“Stand aside. My business is with Yuten Anjiou. Not you.” The bot said.

“Hate to burst your robotic bubble, but you’re not getting near him without getting through me.” Akiza said not moving away.

“Very well. If I must destroy you, then so be it.” The bot said.

Akiza got on her runner and meets up with the bot on the training track while you, Ren, and Misty watched from the sidelines.

“Challenging me will be your fatal mistake.” The bot said.

“So is challenging one who is named the Black Rose.” Akiza said as the duel began.

“Let’s duel!”

Akiza: 4000
Bot: 4000
1311111111111111111111112111211221111111.title: Protecting Her Love

1311111111111111111111112111211221111111.content:
"I'll take the first move." Akiza says. "I draw."

"So, any idea what's the deal with this junk pile?" Ren asks you and Misty.

"No idea." You reply. "I just hope she'll be okay out there."

"She'll be fine." Misty reassures you.

"I'll start by summoning Wall of Ivy in defense mode." Akiza starts.

WoI: 1200 DEF

"Then I'll place two cards face-down and end my turn for now." She wraps up.

"That's it? One small monster and a couple of face-downs?" Ren questions.

"Come on bro, you should know by now. With Akiza, even her slow starts can still fight back hard if you're not careful." You tell him.

"I hope you're right." Misty says as you continue to watch on.
1311111111111111111111112111211221111111.title: A Defensive Wall

1311111111111111111111112111211221111111.content:
“A pathetic display. Let me demonstrate.” The bot draws.

Bot: 1 SC
Akiza: 1 SC

“I summon Ally of Justice Nullifier to the field in attack mode.” The duel bot said.

AoJN: 1600 ATK

“Now attack that Wall of Ivy.” The bot declared.

“Well, just before my wall leaves, it’ll leave behind an Ivy token on to your side of the field.” Akiza said as a token appeared before her monster got destroyed.

“At least that wall was in defense mode.” Ren said.

“You said it.” You said.

“I then end my turn by placing two cards face down.” The bot said.

“Hold it. During your end phase, I’ll play my trap card, Ivy Shackles. Now all of your monsters will become plant monsters during my turn.” Akiza said.

“Not that I’m against her idea, but what will turning his monsters into plants do?” Ren wondered.

“I think I have a theory.” You said.

“Me too.” Misty added.
1311111111111111111111112111211221111111.title: Starting With Light Machinery

1311111111111111111111112111211221111111.content:
"I'm up then." Akiza says.

Akiza: 2 SC
Bot: 2 SC

"And since you were kind enough to destroy my Wall of Ivy last turn, I can now activate my other face-down, Cursed Ivy. Now I can revive my Wall of Ivy back to the field in defense mode." She begins.

WoI: 1200 DEF

"That wall again? It still stands no chance against my Nullifier." The bot taunts.

"We'll see about that. I place another card face-down and end my turn." Akiza wraps up again.

"That confirms it. She's going for that combo." You comment.

"Indeed." Misty adds.

"Uhh... Guy that's hardly seen her duel like this and is completely lost here." Ren pipes up.

"Just watch. If this guy falls for it, then Akiza's about to make a big move on her next turn." You tell your confused brother.
1311111111111111111111112111211221111111.title: Rebuilding The Wall

1311111111111111111111112111211221111111.content:
“It’s my move.” The bot draws.

Bot: 3 SC
Akiza: 3 SC

“First off, I’ll play my face down card, DNA Transplant. With this, all monsters on the field will become the attribute of my choice and I choose light. With that out of the way, I now summon Ally of Justice Thousand Arms in attack mode.” The duel bot said.

AoJTA: 1700 ATK

“Now I’ll have Nullifier attack your wall once more.” The duel bot said.

“Not unless you want to get another Ivy token. And because my wall was destroyed, Cursed Ivy gets destroyed, leaving you with an extra token.” Akiza said as two more tokens appeared.

“No matter. Now, Thousand Arms, attack her directly.” The bot commanded.

“I play the trap card, Ground Capture. Not only does the damage I take gets cut in half, but I also get to draw.” Akiza draws.

Akiza: 3150

“Very well. I end my turn with that.” The bot said.

“Let’s hope Akiza has that plan of hers coming.” You said.
1311111111111111111111112111211221111111.title: Keeping The Plan In Motion

1311111111111111111111112111211221111111.content:
"I'm up then. Draw." Akiza says

Akiza: 4 SC
Bot: 4 SC

"And with my speed counters at four, I can activate the Summon Speeder speed spell." She begins. "With it, I can special summon one level four or below monster from my hand, and I choose Evil Thorn."

ET: 100 ATK

"And now for my Thorn's special ability. I can release it to deal 300 points of damage right to you." She says as her monster explodes, sending thorn shrapnel right at the bot.

Bot: 3700

"And since my Thorn was destroyed by his effect, I'm now allowed to special summon two more from my deck in attack mode, but they don't have their effects." She adds.

ET: 100 ATK
ET: 100 ATK

"Next I'll be releasing one of my thorns to tribute summon from my hand, Rose Tentacles."

RT: 2200 ATK

"And now for her special ability. She's allowed to attack additional times up to the number of plant monsters on your field. So between your three Ivy Tokens, plus Ivy Shackles making both your monsters plants, that gives her a total of six attacks this turn." She reveals.

"Wait, THAT'S what she's been setting up?!" Ren says in shock.

"Yup. It can be devastating if she pulls it off." You reveal. "Guess this junker is about to find that out the hard way.

"Now Rose Tentacles, attack the first Ivy Token." Akiza continues. As her monster shatters the first token. "And whenever an Ivy Token is destroyed, you take 300 points of damage."

Bot: 3400

"And now for the next token. Go Rose Tentacles. Rose Retaliation." She announces as the next token is destroyed.

Bot: 3100

"And one more makes three. One more time." The third and final token was destroyed.

Bot: 2800

"Now attack Ally of Justice Nullfier." She continues as her monster now attacks his own monster.

Bot: 2200

"If Akiza can finish this combo, she's won the duel." Ren says.

"And now it's time I took out that Thousand Arms. Rose Tentacles, attack again." She says, only this time, her monster didn't move. It instead simply sparked. "What's going on?"

The bot begins to laugh at her reaction. "Didn't you know? When Ally of Justice Nullfier battles a light attribute monster, that monster's effect is negated. And since DNA transplant made it a light monster, your Rose loses it's extra attacks this turn." He says.

"Hmph. Then I end my turn." Akiza conceded.

"Damn. So close." You say.
1311111111111111111111112111211221111111.title: A Big Hit

1311111111111111111111112111211221111111.content:
“It now comes back to me.” The bot draws.

Bot: 5 SC
Akiza: 5 SC

“First, I play the speed spell, Angel Baton. I now draw two cards and then discard one. Following that, I activate my own Summon Speeder speed spell. Now I can special summon a level four or below monster from my hand as well. I think I’ll choose Ally of Justice Garadholg in attack mode.” The duel bot said.

AoJG: 1600 ATK

“Next, I’m summoning the tuner monster, Unknown Synchron.” The bot said.

US: 0 ATK

“That’s not good, is it?” Ren asked in concern.

“I don’t think so.” You answered feeling the same.

“Now I tune Unknown Synchron with Ally of Justices Garadholg and Thousand Arms. I synchro summon! Come to me, Ally of Justice Field Marshall!” The bot said.

AoJFM: 2900 ATK

“Ho... ly... shit!” You said looking at how advanced this monster is.

“Got that right.” Ren said.

“Now to bring in the pain. Ally of Justice Field Marshall. Attack that Evil Thorn!” The bot commanded.

“This is going to hurt.” Misty said.

“Akiza! Do something!” You cried out.

“I activate the effect of Ivy Guardian from my hand. Since I’m about to take two thousand or more points of battle damage while I have a plant monster out, I can discard her from my hand to not only negate the attack, but also end the battle phase.” Akiza said as she’s well protected.

“That was close.” You sighed in relief.

“Too close.” Ren added.

“Lucky you. I end my turn for now.” The bot said.

“Ivy Guardian’s effect can only be use one time in a duel. I better make this count.” Akiza thought.
1311111111111111111111112111211221111111.title: From Light Machinery To Heavy Machinery

1311111111111111111111112111211221111111.content:
"I'm up then." Akiza says.

Akiza: 6 SC
Bot: 6 SC

"And I'll start with the Angel Baton speed spell. Now I can draw two cards as long as I discard one." She begins. "Next I summon Spore to the field in defense mode."

SP: 800 DEF

"And now he'll be giving Rose Tentacles a little tune-up. I tune my level one Spore with my level six Rose Tentacles, in order to synchro summon Black Rose Dragon." She continues.

BRD: 2400 ATK

"And now for her special ability. Now, all cards on the field are destroyed." She reveals. It's a costly move, but I don't have very many things in my deck that can stop that thing. This is my only chance.

"Not so fast, I reveal my face-down, Fiendish Chain. Now your dragon's effect is negated and she cannot change her battle position. Too bad for that plan." The bot reveals as Akiza's monster is chained up good.

"Fine then. I change Evil Thorn to defense mode and end my turn." Akiza wraps up.

ET: 300 DEF
1311111111111111111111112111211221111111.title: A Desperate Defense

1311111111111111111111112111211221111111.content:
“It is my turn now.” The bot said.

Bot: 7 SC
Akiza: 7 SC

“I play the speed spell, Sonic Burn. Since I have exactly seven or more speed counters on me. I can use this card to destroy one of your spell and trap cards. Say bye bye to Ivy Shackles.” The bot said.

“No matter. When Ivy Shackles gets destroyed, I get to draw one card.” Akiza said as she draws.

“Very well then. Now, I’ll have my Field Marshall destroy your Black Rose Dragon!” The bot said as Akiza’s ace is destroyed.

Akiza: 2650

“Oh man. This is not good at all.” You said.

“Definitely.” Ren said.

“With that done, I end my turn. So what will you do now that your ace is no longer on the field to protect you?” The bot wondered.
1311111111111111111111112111211221111111.title: In Deep Trouble

1311111111111111111111112111211221111111.content:
"I'm up then." Akiza says.

Akiza: 8 SC
Bot: 8 SC

I can't take on that massive thing like this. I need to just hold out for now and hope for the best. Akiza thinks as she looks at her current hand. This can buy me some time, and hopefully give me a way to win this.

"I summon Blue Rose Dragon in defense mode." She says.

BRD: 1200 DEF

"And with that, I end my turn." She ends.

"That's it? There's gotta be more she can do then that." Ren complains.

"There is." You tell him. "She's hoping she can find a way to win, but she needs her Black Rose Dragon to do it. That monster she summoned is possibly her only way to get it back."

"How's that?" He asks.

"Just watch and see." You tell him as you all turn back.

"Looks like this rose is starting to wilt. I guess you've just given up now. Then I don't mind finishing you off and moving on to Yuten Anjiou." The bot gloats.

"You aren't getting anywhere near him." Akiza objects. "And I'll make sure of it."
1311111111111111111111112111211221111111.title: A Rose By Any Other Name

1311111111111111111111112111211221111111.content:
“We’ll see about that.” The duel bot draws.

Bot: 9 SC
Akiza: 9 SC

“I activate the effect of Speed World 2. By removing seven speed counters, I get to draw a new card.” The bot draws again.

Bot: 2

“Now then, Field Marshall, destroy her Blue Rose Dragon.” He commanded.

“When my Blue Rose Dragon is destroyed and sent to the graveyard, I can summon one plant type monster or my Black Rose Dragon from my graveyard. So, Black Rose Dragon, rise again!” Akiza said.

BRD: 2400 ATK

“No matter. I end my turn with one face down.” The duel bot said.

“At least Akiza got her dragon back.” Ren said.

“It’ll take more than that though.” Misty said.

“You can do this, babe.” You thought in your mind.
1311111111111111111111112111211221111111.title: Holding On By A Thorn

1311111111111111111111112111211221111111.content:
"I'm up then." Akiza says as she puts her hand on top of her deck. I need something to bring down that monster now or I'm finished. Then this guy will... Yuten! At that moment, her mind went back to Misty's fortune, about the queen and her pet dragon being almost swallowed by darkness. NO! I won't let that happen, no matter what.

At that moment, Akiza's signer mark began to glow, as did yours and Ren's eyes.

*****

"Luna! Your mark!" Leo yells as he notices his twin sister's arm begin to glow.

"Akiza..." Luna trails off.

*****

"Hey Yusei, check it out!" Crow yells as he notices his mark glowing.

"Our marks." Jack says as he sees his glow too.

"I can feel it. Akiza's in trouble and she needs the power of the Crimson Dragon." Yusei says as he looks up from his work on the new program. Just then, all three of their marks, as well as Luna's, vanished from their arms.

*****

Akiza's mark also disappeared, only for the full mark of the dragon to appear on her back. "Everyone..." She says to herself as she notices her deck begin to glow. "Let's do this. I draw!"

Akiza: 10 SC
Bot: 3 SC

Speed Fusion? I don't remember having this card in my deck. But it can still help me. I have ten speed counters now, so with the effect of Speed World 2 I can use this to destroy that monster. Then again, there's no way of knowing what that face-down is. I have to think of something else. She thinks.

"I activate the effect of Speed World 2. Now by removing seven speed counters I can draw one card. And the speed spell in my hand is Speed Fusion." She begins.

Akiza: 3 SC

"Here goes nothing." She says as she draws her next card. Lonefire Blossom? Is my deck trying to tell me something? She thinks to herself as she looks at her new card. No, there's no time for overthinking. I just have to do what feels natural.

"I summon Lonefire Blossom in defense mode." She continues.

LB: 1400 DEF

"And now with his special ability, I can tribute one plant-type monster on my field to special summon a new one from my deck. So by releasing my Blossom, I can special summon Tytannial Princess of Camellias in attack mode." She says.

TPC: 2800 ATK

"Here we go." She says as she pulls the next card from her hand. "I activate the speed spell Speed Fusion. Now since I have two or more speed counters, I'm allowed to fusion summon one monster as long as I have the required materials to summon it. So now I'll fuse my Princess with my Dragon to form a whole new monster."

"What?!" The bot says in confusion.

"Could it be?" You ask aloud.

"When the strength of a dragon and the kindness of a princess combine, a whole new monarch will be unleashed. I fusion summon Black Rose Queen!" She announces as her blank card begins to glow, before changing before her very eyes as text and an image appear on it.

On the field, you watched as Akiza's two monsters combined. The end product looked like a human version of Black Rose Dragon, with dark skin, an outfit made of crimson rose petals, and carrying a thorny spear in her hand.

BRQ: 3200 ATK

"Amazing." Akiza says as she looks up in awe at her new monster.

"Misty, your fortune." You reminder.

"Do you truly think...?" She asks.

"Guess we'll see soon." Ren says.

"So you have a new monster. It still won't save you." The bot taunts.

"We'll see about that. Black Rose Queen, attack Ally of Justice Field Marshal." She calls out as her Queen makes a dive at the bot's monster, spear ready to strike.

"Not so fast. I play the trap card Mirror Force. Now all monsters you control in attack mode are destroyed." He cackles.

"Not quite." Akiza objects.

"What?" The bot wonders.

"My Queen has a special ability. Now, since she would be destroyed by a battle or card effect, I can remove from play one plant type monster in my graveyard to protect her from destruction. So by removing one of my Evil Thorns, my Queen is free to break through your mirror force and right into your monster." She reveals as Evil Thorn's spirit appears, creating a barrier around Black Rose Queen as she dives through the Mirror Force barrier and impales Field Marshal with her spear, destroying it.

"Oh no!" The bot yells as he takes damage.

Bot: 1900

"With that, I think I'll end my turn." Akiza wraps up.

"Talk about a big move." Ren says.

"Yeah. She finally figured out her card." You sigh in relief. "Now win this Akiza."
1311111111111111111111112111211221111111.title: A New Queen

1311111111111111111111112111211221111111.content:
“I will not let you.” The duel bot draws.

Bot: 4 SC
Akiza: 4 SC

“I activate the Overburst speed spell to increase my speed counters by four as long as they go to one when my end phase comes.” The bot said.

Bot: 8 SC

“And now, I play the speed spell, Speed Unity. Since I have eight or more speed counters, I can summon as many monsters with two thousand or less attack points from my graveyard. However, their effects are negated. No matter though. I summon Unknown Synchron and Allies of Justice Nullifier and Thousand Arms back to the field in defense mode.” The duel bot said.

US: 0 DEF
AoJN: 1200 DEF
ApJTA: 0 DEF

“Good luck getting past this defense. I end my turn.” The bot said.

Bot: 1 SC
1311111111111111111111112111211221111111.title: Building A Wall

1311111111111111111111112111211221111111.content:
"I'm up then." Akiza says.

Akiza: 5 SC
Bot: 2 SC

"Sorry pal, but this duel is over." She says as she begins her turn. "First, I release my last Evil Thorn to summon Gigaplant from my hand."

GP: 2400 ATK

"Then I'll activate the effect of the Spore in my graveyard. Now by removing from play one plant monster in my graveyard, I can special summon Spore to my field." She continues. "So by removing from play my second Evil Thorn, I can special summon Spore to my field and increase it's level by that of the removed monster."

SP: 400 ATK
Lvl: 1->2

"So what? Even if all three of them attacked this turn, I still survive." The bot gloats.

"I wouldn't say that. You see, my Queen has another unique ability. By releasing one plant-type monster on my field, she's allowed to attack all of your monsters once each, so long as you take half damage from any battles involving her this turn. But that shouldn't really matter much since all your monsters are in defense mode anyway." She says.

"Oh no! But with Gigaplant...!" He starts only for Akiza to cut him off.

"So by releasing Spore, my Black Rose Queen can attack all of your monsters. Now go, attack Unknown Synchron!" She says as her monster slices through the first monster. "Next, Ally of Justice Thousand Arms." Another attack, another destroyed monster.

"And finally, Ally of Justice Nullfier." She calls out as her queen cut through the third and final monster. "And now, your field is empty for a direct attack. Go Gigaplant, chomp down on his life points." Akiza's monster went in for a direct attack, vines emerging from the ground and tearing away at the Bot's runner, causing him to wreck.

Bot: 0000

"She did it!!" You yell as Ren and Misty hug.

With the duel over, Akiza pulled up next to the fallen robot. His body was now even more damaged and was wildly sparking. "No. I-I couldn't get Master Primo's graces." He says.

"Why do you care about him so much?" Akiza asks.

"The same reason y-you humans care for the approval of the one you call 'father'. He created me, gave me purpose, only to cast me aside like t-t-trash." He sputters. "T-t-t t-t-tell me. In my last moments of function, tell me what was wrong with me that had me deemed defective?"

Akiza looked over the fallen bot a bit, then sighed to herself. "I honestly don't know. Your master was a nut with plans I can't even begin to understand. Whatever his reasons were, I can't tell you." She says.

The duel bot gave one last conflicted look at her answer. He opened his mouth to say something, only for his eyes to go dim. Akiza sighed with a bit of pity for the bot before driving back to where you three were waiting.
1311111111111111111111112111211221111111.title: Tearing Through

1311111111111111111111112111211221111111.content:
Akiza drives back to you three as you, Ren, and Misty run towards her to congratulate her on her victory.

“You did it, Akiza! I knew you could!” You cheered as you hugged her and kissed her on the cheek.

“Easy there, Yuten. But thank you.” Akiza said with a smile.

“Hey, guys. Did you find anything?” You asked Yusei and the boys.

“Not much, except for this.” Yusei said as he pulls out a card.

It turns out to be Leo’s Power Tool Dragon.

“It’s Leo’s dragon! He must’ve dropped this too!” Ren said as he sees the card.

“He left it in the street. My guess he wanted us to find it as a trail towards that way.” Jack said pointing straight.

“You think so?” Akiza wondered.

“It’s a hunch. But it’s also the best possibility we have.” Yusei said.

“Then let’s follow it.” You said as you all get loving together.

You kept driving until you spotted another card. You picked it up and it’s Luna’s Regulus card.

“It is a trail. We must be in the right direction.” You said as you picked up the pace until...
1311111111111111111111112111211221111111.title: Regrouping with 5d’s

choices: Side with Ren and go in the front
Agree with Akiza about sneaking in
Before you decide, a nearby monitor begins to turn on
1311111111111111111111112111211221111111.content:
You all continued following the trail of cards out of the city and into the woods. There, the trail ends as you soon find yourselves with eighty cards, equaling both their decks. "Uh, guys, looks like we're out of cards to follow." Crow announces.

"That's fine." Ren says as he revs up and continues driving forward. "I know it was him now and where he took them."

"He? What's he talking about?" Jack asked as you all followed your brother.

"Before we met back up with you, we got a call from Trudge. Apparently, Sayer escaped from prison last night and is at large. We think he might be the one behind this, no matter how much we wish it wasn't true." Akiza tells them.

"So Ren must know where we are well enough that he knows where Sayer is hiding from here?" Yusei asks.

"I guess so." You answer.

"Come on you two, you were with me when we were last here. Doesn't this place seem familiar at all?" Ren asks you and Akiza.

The two of you took a bit of time to observe your surroundings. "Now that you mention it, this place does feel familiar." You admit.

"It should. Look up ahead. We're here." Ren says as you notice a familiar structure. It was the Arcadia Movement blacksite where you freed Toby right after you met Ren. "Figures he'd be right back to his old tricks of torturing kids at this place the first chance he got."

You all pull up in front of the building as you dismount your runners. "Alright, the secret passage is right over here. It leads right to the detention area where the kids were last time. It's likely that Sayer is keeping the twins in the same place." Akiza says while heading over to the secret door you used last time.

"That's nice." Ren says as he slaps Red-Eyes on his duel disk and uses it to fire a blast at the front door. "You guys go that way and find the twins. I'll smash my way through this entire facility until I find Sayer and tear him a new one."

"Wait, we should stick together on this. No telling what can happen in there." You step in. "Yusei, can you guys hold out up here and call Trudge? Tell him we might have found Sayer and the twins and need backup."

"You got it Yuten." He replies.

"Alright, bro, you're the tiebreaker then. Which way do we go?" Ren asks
1311111111111111111111112111211221111111.title: A Familiar Place

1311111111111111111111112111211221111111.content:
“I think it’s best if we could go in the front like Ren said. I mean, knowing Sayer, he’s likely expecting us to be here, anyway.” You suggested.

“Now that’s more like it.” Ren said as you and Akiza followed Ren inside.

The cells inside are indeed empty and there’s no sign of the twins. That is until you spotted someone up ahead and it’s none other than Sayer himself.

“Well well well. You’re finally here, Yuten. I was feeling disappointment that you weren’t going to show up.” Sayer said in a sinister tone.

“Sayer. How did you escape from prison?” You demanded to know.

“You can thank some new friends of mine. The ones that called themselves the Emperors of Illiaster.” Sayer said.

“Them? I thought you and Illiaster hated each other.” You said.

“Well, you know what they say, “the enemy of my enemy is my friend”. Don’t you agree?” Sayer said while chuckling evilly.

“Enough of this! Where’s Leo and Luna? Where are the twins, you bastard?!” Ren yelled at Sayer.

“Oh don’t worry, Ren. They’re safe and sound, for now.” Sayer said as he shows you the twins on the monitor.

“Let them go, Sayer!” Akiza demanded.

“I will once you hand ownership of the Arcadia Movement back to me.” Sayer said.

“That’s what this is about? Taking back the movement?” You guessed.

“Indeed. Once you hand it over, I’ll give the twins back to you unharmed.” Sayer said.

“Not on your life, asshole!” You defied him.

“Come on now. You wouldn’t want anything bad happening to those poor kids, do you?” Sayer said sinisterly.

“You’re right on that. That’s why we’re going to save them and make sure the movement is out of your reach.” You said with defiance.

“In that case, how about we wager this in a duel?” Sayer offered.

“Okay. If I win, you’ll release this kids and you’re going back to jail peacefully.” You said.

“Fine. However, should I win, the movement returns to me. Agreed?” Sayer said getting his duel disk ready.

“You got it.” You said as you were getting ready too until Ren stopped you.

“No need, little bro. I’ll take care of him.” Ren said stepping up to the plate.

“Are you sure, Ren?” Akiza wondered as Ren gets his duel disk ready.

“I’m definitely sure. It’s been a long time coming. Now is my chance.” Ren said.

“So you’re dueling me, Ren? You’re not going to run away like last time, are you?” Sayer mocked Ren a little.

“You’re right. I let you continue doing your sick deeds because I didn’t faced you back then. But I’ve gotten stronger since then. Now, I know I can whip your ass, Sayer.” Ren said with bravery.

“Then come and prove it.” Sayer said getting ready to duel.

“This is for the twins and also for every single psychic you’d used and tortured. Time for some payback.” Ren said doing the same.

“Ren.” Akiza thought in her head.

“Go get him, bro.” You thought in your head too.

“Let’s duel!”

Ren: 4000
Sayer: 4000
1311111111111111111111112111211221111111.title: No Need To Knock

1311111111111111111111112111211221111111.content:
"I hope you don't mind if I go first Ren." Sayer says.

"Go for it. I'll kick your ass either way." Ren responds.

"How kind of you." Sayer says as he draws. "By the way, to those of you that have seen my deck before, I see it only fit to tell you that it's seen an upgrade in the past year." He says as his gaze goes from Ren to Akiza.

"You can have the god cards themselves and they won't save you from me." Ren snarls.

"We'll see. I summon Serene Psychic Witch in defense mode." He begins.

SPW: 1200 DEF

"That's certainly a new one." Akiza comments.

"Then I'll place two cards face-down and end my turn." He concludes.

"That's it? All that hype for this new deck of yours and that's all you have to start with?" Ren comments. "I think your time in the Facility rotted out whatever bits of your brain weren't already rotten.

"We'll see. Make your move." Sayer comments.
1311111111111111111111112111211221111111.title: New and Improved

1311111111111111111111112111211221111111.content:
“Your funeral!” Ren draws his card. “I summon Armageddon Knight in attack mode.”

AK: 1400 ATK

“When Armageddon Knight is summoned to the field, I get to send a dark monster from my deck to my graveyard. I choose my Necro Gardna. With that out of the way, I’ll have my knight attack your witch.” Ren said as Sayer’s monster gets destroyed.

“Thank you for doing that, you’ve just triggered my trap, Telepathic Power. Since you destroyed one of my psychic monsters by battle, the same monster that destroyed it is destroyed as well.” Sayer said as Ren’s knight gets reduced to atoms. “There’s more. I also gain life points equal to your knight’s attack points. Thanks for the extra boost.”

Sayer: 5400

“Shit! Should’ve saw that coming.” Ren grunted.

“And I bet you didn’t see this coming either. When Serene Psychic Witch gets destroyed and sent to the graveyard, I can remove from play one psychic monster from my deck as long it has two thousand or less attack points. Plus, I get to summon that same monster on my next turn. I choose my Esper Girl.” Sayer said.

“Whatever. I place one card face down and end my turn.” Ren said.

“It’s such a shame, Ren. When I discovered your ultimate power, you would’ve made a fine weapon for my army. Instead, here you are out to defeat me. My how things have turned out.” Sayer said.

“Yeah. Because I’m not dumb enough to fall for anything you say or do to me.” Ren said.

“Oh no? That last move said otherwise.” Sayer taunted.

“Just make a move already!” Ren growls at him.
1311111111111111111111112111211221111111.title: Ren Fell For It

1311111111111111111111112111211221111111.content:
"As you wish." Sayer says as he draws. "First, since it's the Standby Phase after Serene Psychic Witch was destroyed and she's still in my graveyard, Esper Girl can now be special summoned."

EG: 300 DEF

"And since she was special summoned from being removed from play, I can now take the top card of my deck and remove it from play face-down." He begins.

"What does that get you?" Ren asks in confusion.

"You'll see soon." Sayer responds. "Next, I'll summon Risebell the Star Adjuster in defense mode."

RSA: 800 DEF

"Now I think it's time for a little synchro action. I tune my level two Esper Girl to my level three Risebell, in order to synchro summon Magical Android to my field." He reveals.

MA: 2400 ATK

"This isn't good." Akiza says.

"Fill me in here. the only time I saw Sayer's deck was a couple cards before I floored him on my second turn, and this wasn't one of them." You ask.

"Magical Android is one of Sayer's best monsters. The only one stronger than that is his ace, Thought Ruler Archfiend." She explains.

"That's bad." You admit.

"Indeed, and it's about to get worse." Sayer says, having heard you two. "But before my android attacks, since Esper Girl was sent to my graveyard, I get to take the card she removed and add it to my hand."

"And now, Magical Android will attack you directly." He announces as his monster fires a blast from her staff right at Ren.

"Not so fast. I play my face-down, Draining Shield. Now since you attacked me, I can negate the attack, as well as gain life points equal to your monster's attack points." Ren reveals as a barrier appears to block the attack.

Ren: 6400

"How do you like that?" He asks

"Not bad. I'll place one card face-down and end my turn. And since my turn is over, Magical Android heals my life points by 600 for every Psychic-type monster on my field." Sayer says.

Sayer: 6000

"You're up." He concludes.
1311111111111111111111112111211221111111.title: A Magical Turn

1311111111111111111111112111211221111111.content:
“That it is.” Ren draws his card. “First off, I play the spell card, Graceful Charity. I now draw three cards and then I must discard two of them away.” Ren draws his three extra cards and discarded two of them to his graveyard.

He then spotted a card that he’s glad to see.

“Red-Eyes.” Ren then gave out a small smirk on his face knowing what he must do.

“Okay, Sayer. You’re going to be in real trouble. I play the spell card, Ancient Rules. I can now special summon a level five or higher monster from my hand as long as it’s a normal monster. Take it to the sky, Red-Eyes Black Dragon!” Ren said as one of his best monsters appeared on to the field.

REBD: 2400 ATK

“Yeah! Now we’re talking!” You cheered as Akiza smiles at his play.

“Ahh. Red-Eyes. It’s been a while since I’ve seen this monster. Ashamed that it’s equal strength to my Magical Android won’t make a difference.” Sayer said.

“Then I’ll just have to change that with the help of my Shrink spell card. So Magical Android’s attack points are cut in half.” Ren said as Sayer’s monster gets weaker.

MA: 1200 ATK

“Way to go, Ren! Go get him!” You cheered.

“With pleasure. Red-Eyes, take out Magical Android with your Inferno Fire Blast!” Ren declared as his dragon blast the android away.

Sayer: 4800

“Ha! How do you like that?” Ren said with confidence.

“Not bad. But you’ll have to do much better than that.” Sayer said with hardly any signs of retreat.

“Don’t worry. I will. For now, I’ll place this little card face down and that’s that.” Ren said.
1311111111111111111111112111211221111111.title: The Blast With Eyes Of Red

1311111111111111111111112111211221111111.content:
"Then it's my move." Sayer says as he draws. "First, I'll play my face-down, Psychic Trigger. Now since my life points are lower than yours, by removing from play two psychic-type monsters in my graveyard, I can draw two cards. So I'll remove Esper Girl and Serene Psychic Witch to draw two more cards. Then I'll activate the continuous spell, Future Glow."

"What's that do?" Ren asks.

"A good question. With Future Glow, I can remove from play one psychic-type monster in my graveyard. Then, as long as this card stays on my field, any psychic-type monster on my field gains attack points equal to the removed monster's level multiplied by 200. So with this I'll remove from play Magical Android to give all other psychic-type monsters 1000 attack points." Sayer tells him.

"Too bad you don't have any psychic monsters on your field." Ren reminds.

"Just wait, because here's where the fun starts. I activate the Psychic Feel Zone spell card. Now since I have one psychic tuner and one psychic non-tuner removed from the game, by putting them back in the graveyard, I can special summon a psychic synchro monster who's level equals the total of the two monsters' levels." Sayer reveals.

"Say what?!" Ren questions.

"Can he do that?" You ask Akiza.

"I don't know. I've never seen this card before." She admits.

"So now I'll put Magical Android and Esper Girl back into my graveyard. And since their combined levels are seven, I can special summon a level seven synchro monster. So say hello to Psychic Lifetrancer." Sayer says.

PL: 2400 ATK

"And don't forget, since Future Glow is on the field, she gains 1000 attack points thanks to Magical Android." He reminds.

PL: 3400 ATK

"But that means she's now stronger than Red-Eyes." You say in shock.

"That's right. But first, her special ability lets me remove from play one psychic-type monster in my graveyard to gain 1200 life points. So I think I'll remove Magical Android once more." He says as he removes his card.

Sayer: 6000

"So now it's like Red-Eyes never even hit him?" Ren says in frustration.

"Yeah. It's a shame, isn't it? Bet you wish baby bro Yuten just handed over the Movement when I asked, huh? Then none of this would be happening to you." Sayer taunts.

"Not a chance. My bro is gonna forge a new path for psychic duelists that you never even tried to see, and me and Akiza are gonna see him get there. Akiza as the shield that keeps him safe, and I'll be the sword that cuts the way through." Ren rants.

"How poetic. But right about now, I think you may want to wish for that shield right about now, because Psychic Lifetrancer is about to destroy your Red-Eyes. Attack!" Sayer calls out as his monster throws two balls of energy at Ren's dragon, destroying it.

Ren: 5400

"Aaaaahhhh!!" Ren screams in pain.

"Ren!!" You call out.

"Did you really think I wasn't going to hold back my powers on you? After what you did, I plan to hit you with the full force of my abilities as we go. With that, I'll end my turn." Sayer concludes. "Now the question is, can you even stay standing long enough to cut that path you talked up so much?"
1311111111111111111111112111211221111111.title: A Blast From the Future

1311111111111111111111112111211221111111.content:
“Time to find out.” Ren said as he draws. “I play the spell, Card of Demise. I now draw cards until I’m holding five of them as long I discard my whole hand in five turns.” Ren draws his five cards. “Then I’ll play my face down, Call of the Haunted. With this, I can summon a monster from my graveyard. Come on back, Red-Eyes.” Ren said.

REBD: 2400 ATK

“You really think he can help you again this time? That’s a laugh.” Sayer said.

“Not exactly. Because I have this. The spell Inferno Fire Blast!” Ren said activating his card.

“A spell that’s named after his attack?” Sayer wondered.

“Yep. With this, Red-Eyes can now make a direct attack on you right now. Get him.” Ren said.

Sayer: 3600

“Now he’s back in the driver’s seat.” Akiza said as you nodded.

“Well, luckily for you, Red-Eyes can’t attack on the turn I used this spell card. But I’m not concern. I now summon the tuner monster, Unknown Synchron.” Ren said.

US: 0 ATK

“If this is what I think it is...” You said.

“You better believe it, little bro. I tune Unknown Synchron with Red-Eyes Black Dragon. Time to meet an old friend, Sayer. I synchro summon, Beelze of the Diabolic Dragons!” Ren said as he summons his ace dragon.

BotDD: 3000 ATK

“Well well, you managed to get your best monster. But it’ll do you no good.” Sayer said.

“Don’t underestimate me, Sayer. You of all people should know that. In case you forgotten, Beelze, attack Psychic Lifetrancer! Twin Plasma Cannon!” Ren commanded.

“You do know that my Lifetrancer is still stronger, right?” Sayer reminded.

Ren: 5000

“I know. There’s a reason for that attack. Not only is Beelze safe, but he also gains attack points equal to the damage I took.” Ren said feeling a bit of a sting.

BotDD: 3400 ATK

“So it was just to make him stronger.” Sayer said.

“Bingo. That’s one of the main reasons why he’s my best monster. The pain he feels makes him stronger just as I was stronger through every trial I’ve been into.” Ren said standing his ground.

“Really? Can you say that when you’re rampaging?” Sayer asked getting Ren’s attention. “When I discovered your inner power, you were known as a force that can’t be stopped. A beast that can’t be tamed. You let yourself into you anger and you could’ve used it to help me with my goals of revenge against the non-psychics of the world. Instead, you choose to back down.” Sayer said.

“That’s because I don’t want to be that kind of person. Thanks to Yuten and everyone else back home, I was able to take control of that power.” Ren said.

“Have you?” Sayer asked sinisterly while Ren growls.

“Whatever. Back to the duel. I now activate the effect of Dark Nephthys from my hand. By removing two dark monsters from my graveyard from play, I can send it straight to the graveyard and then he can be special summoned to the field on my next turn. With that, my turn’s done.” Ren said feeling a bit peeved.

“Do you think Sayer’s getting under Ren’s skin?” Akiza wondered with concern.

“Maybe. He needs to keep himself cool or else who knows what he’ll do.” Sayer said.

“I just wished I know why Sayer is always so evil.” You thought.

“A very excellent question, my champion.” A voice said in your head, which is none other than your Blue-Eyes.

“Blue-Eyes? Where did you come from?” You thought.

“I’ve always been here with you, Yuten.” Blue-Eyes said.

“Point taken. Any particular reason why Sayer always seemed such an evil douchebag?” You wondered.

“Being outcasted and discriminated can reveal the worst of humanity. I believe something has caused Sayer to believe that the non-psychic humans should be eradicated.” Blue-Eyes suggested.

“You mean like he snapped somehow?” You figured.

“Perhaps. But no one really knows for sure.” Blue-Eyes said.

“Ain’t that the truth.” You said in your head as you looked on.
1311111111111111111111112111211221111111.title: Cutting Through

1311111111111111111111112111211221111111.content:
"It's my move now." Sayer begins. "And I'll start by summoning Silent Psychic Wizard to the field in defense mode."

SPW: 0000 DEF

"And when he's summoned to the field, I can remove from play one psychic-type monster in my graveyard, so Esper Girl will be removed from play once more. Next I'll switch Psychic Lifetrancer into defense mode." He continues.

PL: 2000 DEF

"And with that, I'll end my turn." He concludes.

"That's it, huh?" Ren taunts. "All that big talk and you back off at the sight of my ace? Guess I can't blame you."

"All in due time Ren. All in due time. I'll admit your beast is formidable and a difficult one to beat, but it has been done, hasn't it? Like at your little demonstration dinner you lot threw a while back. Dear little Akiza was able to break right through." Sayer says. "Aren't you worried that you're relying too much on him?"

"Not a chance. He's every bit a part of me as I am. I'm not going to fall for your tricks any longer." Ren spits back.

"We'll see about that. Then go on. It's your move." Sayer waves off.
1311111111111111111111112111211221111111.title: Thinking Ahead

1311111111111111111111112111211221111111.content:
“If you say so.” Ren draws. “First off, since it’s my turn now, the effect of my Dark Nephthys allows him to be summoned from my graveyard.” Ren said.

DN: 2400 ATK

“After that, his other ability activates. When he’s special summoned, he can destroy one spell or trap card on the field. Say goodbye to Future Glow.” Ren then destroyed Sayer’s spell card.

“Sweet. Now Sayer’s psychics looses the power up.” Akiza said as you nodded.

“With that out of the way, Beelze, destroy Psychic Lifetrancer.” Beelze destroyed Lifetrancer. “Now, Dark Nephthys, destroy his Silient Psychic Wizard.” Nephthys then destroys Sayer’s Wizard.

“Impressive. However, when you sent my Wizard to my graveyard, you activated his special ability, allowing me to summon my removed from play Esper Girl.” Sayer said.

EG: 300 DEF

“When she is special summoned from my removed from play zone, the top card of deck is banished face down.” Sayer said sending his top card away.

“Like that’s going to scare me.” Ren said.

“No. But I think you would scare anyone. It’s amazing that dear little Misty is still hanging on to you.” Sayer said to push Ren’s buttons.

“Don’t you bring her into this!” Ren yelled in an angry tone.

“Why? I’m only stating some facts. After all, what chances she’ll leave you the next time you go insane again?” Sayer said to push more.

“Shut your damned mouth, Sayer! I mean it!” Ren yelled again.

“Ren! Don’t listen to him, bro! He’s just trying to get into your head!” You reasoned with Ren as your brother calms down.

“Right. Sorry. I place one card face down and that’s that.” Ren said as you looked at the monitor of the twins.

“They’ll be okay, Yuten. You just need to have faith.” Blue-Eyes said to you.

“For all of our sakes, I hope you’re right.” You said back.
1311111111111111111111112111211221111111.title: Sayer Plays Mind Games

1311111111111111111111112111211221111111.content:
"Then it's my move. I draw." Sayer begins. "I'll start by summoning an old favorite that you might remember Ren, Telekinetic Shocker."

TS: 1700 ATK

"What happened to new and improved? If memory served he was one of your worse cards." Ren comments.

"What can I say? I still have a few favorites." Sayer defends sarcastically. "But if you truly want to see something new, watch as I tune my level two Esper Girl to my level four Telekinetic Shocker. Now behold a brand new beast to my arsenal, HTS Psyhemoth!"

HTSP: 2400 ATK

"Big deal. It's still nowhere near as powerful as my Beelze." Ren shrugs off.

"We'll see. By the way, since Esper Girl was removed from the field, the card she removed from play is now added to my hand." He continues as he adds his card. "Next I activate the spell Psylock. Now at the cost of 500 life points, I can prevent you from activating one face-down spell or trap card on your field until my second Standby Phase after I play it. So that face-down of yours is getting locked away for a while."

Sayer: 3100

"And now, HTS Psyhemoth will attack your Beelze." He reveals.

"Are you nuts?! No way is that thing stronger than my dragon. Even if it was, Beelze can't be destroyed anyway." Ren questions as Sayer's monster rams itself into Ren's dragon.

Sayer: 2100

"Indeed. However, my Psyhemoth has a special ability. When he battles a monster, by removing him from play, I can also remove from play the monster he battled. So now Beelze will be removed from play." Sayer says as both monsters fade away.

"No way!!!" Ren says, astonished at Beelze being defeated like that.

"Not good. That was Ren's ace monster." You say.

"At least Sayer's field is empty. Now it's just one attack from Nephthys and it's all over." Akiza adds.

"We'll see about that. I play the spell card Remembering the Forgotten Power. Now at the price of another 500 life points, I can remove from play two psychic-type monsters in my graveyard to add one spell card from my graveyard to my hand. So by removing my Esper Girl and Telekinetic Shocker, I can add my Psychic Feel Zone back to my hand." Sayer retorts as he regains his card.

Sayer: 1600

"Oh no." Ren says, knowing where this was going.

"Oh yes. Now I play Psychic Feel Zone, which let's me take two psychic monsters that are removed from play and put them in my graveyard to special summon a synchro monster that equals their combined levels, as long as there is one tuner and one non-tuner involved." Sayer continues. "So I'll put Esper Girl and HTS Psyhemoth back into my graveyard."

"Oh no. Those two monsters' levels equal eight. But that would mean..." Akiza starts.

"That's right. Say hello to my Thought Ruler Archfiend!!" Sayer calls out as his ace is revealed.

TRA: 2700 ATK

"You're lucky I've already conducted my battle phase, or you wouldn't have survived. With that, I'll place one card face down and end my turn." He finally concludes.
1311111111111111111111112111211221111111.title: Defeating the Diabolic Dragon

1311111111111111111111112111211221111111.content:
“Here I go then.” Ren draws. “Alright. I’ll just switch my Dark Nephthys into defense mode and I’ll set a monster face down and that’s that.” Ren said.

“Seems to me that you’re in a pickle right now, Ren. It’s quite sad really.” Sayer teased Ren a bit.

“Yeah. Well, I’ve been in worse scenarios before and I’ve managed to get myself back on top. Because of that, I’ve gotten better after every single duel. Meanwhile, all you’ve done was pulled strings. You’ve gotten soft.” Ren said.

“You’re certainly one to talk about being soft, Ren. With all the power you possessed, you could’ve been one of the most powerful psychics in the world. Instead, you chose to hold it all back. That makes you weak.” Sayer said.

“No. It means I know what’s wrong and what’s right. At least I’m able to see things more clearly rather than being blinded by desires of revenge.” Ren said.

“Such a shameful one you are.” Sayer said as he shakes his head.

“Look, are you here to duel or trying to get into my fucking head!?!” Ren yelled seething again.
1311111111111111111111112111211221111111.title: Ren's Struggle

1311111111111111111111112111211221111111.content:
"Who says I can't do both?" Sayer asks as he draws. "I think it's time I showed you true power. I activate the Miracle Synchro Fusion spell card. This lets me summon a fusion monster by removing from play cards from my field or graveyard as long as I use at least one synchro monster."

"Wait, you don't mean you're going to..." Ren starts.

"That's right. I'm fusing Thought Ruler Archfiend with the Telekinetic Shocker in my graveyard. And with these two together, I fusion summon Ultimate Axon Kicker in attack mode." He announces.

UAK: 2900 ATK

"This is not good." Ren says nervously.

"It's about to get much worse." Sayer adds. "Ultimate Axon Kicker, attack Dark Nephthys with Psyonic Strike." Sayer's monster unleashes a massive blast from it's arms destroying Ren's monster and slamming right into Ren.

Ren: 3700

"AAAAHHHHHHH!!!" He screams as the attack hits him before crumpling to his knees.

"What happened? Ren's monster was in defense mode. He shouldn't have been hurt." You object.

"He wouldn't be, if it weren't for my Axon Kicker's ability that lets him pierce through a monster's defenses when he attacks." Sayer unveils. "By the way, he has another effect too. When he destroys a monster in battle, I recover life points equal to the destroyed monster's attack points."

Sayer: 4000

"So now it's like this whole duel didn't happen?!" Akiza asks.

"Not quite. It looks like Ren took a big hit from it all. He can barely even stand." Sayer points out as you all turn back to see Ren struggling just to stay up on his knees. "Can he even duel anymore?"
1311111111111111111111112111211221111111.title: Kicking Out the Chair

1311111111111111111111112111211221111111.content:
“I... I can still duel alright.” Ren gets back on his feet. “Just watch me.” Ren draws his card. “I’ll just placed one card face down and I’ll end my turn.” Ren said.

“Look at you, holding on by a mere thread. You can barely make a move now. I thought you were trained better than this.” Sayer said.

“This taunting of yours is really annoying. I can’t wait to shut you up.” Ren said.

“We’ll see about that. For now, during your end phase, I’ll play the trap card, Psychic Rejuvenation. This allows me to gain one thousand life points for every psychic monster on my side of the field. Since my kicker is here, that’s how much I gain.” Sayer said.

Sayer: 5000

“Like Ren said, really annoying.” You said to Akiza.

“If you think for one second that having your fusion monster out and regaining life points will save you, then you’re dead wrong, jackass.” Ren said.
1311111111111111111111112111211221111111.title: Keeping The Will To Fight

1311111111111111111111112111211221111111.content:
"I'm not the one that needs saving here Ren. You are." Sayer replies as he draws. "And I'll prove it. But first, since it's the second Standby Phase after I activated Psylock, your first face-down is freed. Now I activate the equip spell Psychic Blade. Now I can pay life points in multiples of one hundred to increase the attack and defense of a monster on my field by that amount. So by paying the 1000 life points I gained from my Psychic Rejuvenation, I can power up my Kicker by 1000 points each."

Sayer: 4000

UAK: 3900 ATK

"This is gonna hurt." Ren says in fear.

"I hope it does. Maybe the pain will teach you the error for crossing me." Sayer says. "Now, Ultimate Axon Kicker, attack Ren's face-down monster and end this duel." Sayer's beast slashed it's new sword, firing a burst of energy at Ren's card before exploding on impact. "I win." But when the smoke from the explosion cleared, Ren and his card were still there. "No way. How are you still standing?"

"First, my face-down monster was my Spirit Reaper, who cannot be destroyed in battle, so no regaining life points for you." Ren reveals.

SR: 200 DEF

"But Axon Kicker's ability should still pierce his defenses. How do you still have life points?" Sayer asks.

"With my second face-down, Defense Draw. Now I take no battle damage from one attack and get to draw a card." Ren responds as he draws his new card.

"Very clever. I'll end my turn with that then. I hope you enjoyed this last little spark of defiance, because next turn you're through." Sayer concludes.
1311111111111111111111112111211221111111.title: A Desperate Save

1311111111111111111111112111211221111111.content:
“As much I hate to admit it, he maybe right. I’m barely hanging on. I may have survived this round, but I don’t think I can withstand another blow from that Axon Kicker of his. There must something here I can use.” Ren said as he pictures Red-Eyes and Beelze in his mind. “Come on guys. I know you two have issues with each other, but I need you both now more than ever. Please, work with me here.” Ren thought as something was happening to his deck.

“What’s that?” Sayer wondered.

“What in the world?” You wondered as well as Akiza looks confused herself.

When Ren drew the card that was glowing, he can see his chance. “I play the spell, Dark Fortune. By paying half my life points, I can draw one card. If that card is a dark monster, I get to draw cards for every two levels it has. If it’s not, that card is removed from play and I must end my turn.” Ren said.

Ren: 1850

“That’s a very big risk you’re playing at. You do know that if you fail on this draw, you’ll fail in the duel too.” Sayer said.

“I do know that. But, I’m willing to take that chance. Here we go!” Ren draws in fashion.

The card was then revealed to be...

The Dark Creator.

“Yes!” You cheered with Akiza as Sayer was actually surprised.

“Since my Dark Creator is a level eight monster. I can draw four cards.” Ren draws his four cards and sees the hand he has now. “Well, Sayer, this is the end.” Ren said with a smile.

“You really expect me to believe what you’re saying? You don’t have what you need to win and you know it.” Sayer said denying your claim.

“Well then, time to make a believer out of you. First off, I’ll play the face down that you locked down. Escape from the Dark Dimension. This will bring back one of my removed from play dark monsters. So come back home, Beelze.” Ren said back.

BotDD: 3000 ATK

“I’m not impressed.” Sayer said.

“Let me finish. Now I’ll play Monster Reborn to bring back my Red-Eyes Black Dragon from my graveyard.” Ren said as his other best dragon comes back too.

REBD: 2400 ATK

“Now for the icing on the cake, I play the spell, Polymerization. With this, I now fuse Beelze and Red-Eyes together.” Ren said as his two dragons merged.

As the fusion was happening, Ren was glowing purple during the entire event while you all looked to see what’s happening. When it stopped, the fusion stopped, the purple aura quickly died down as Ren opened his eyes. His expressions shows that he wasn’t violently angry. Instead, he was calm as his eyes were red looking at Sayer.

“Sayer, I present to you Red-Eyes Diabolic Dragon!” Ren said as his new beast has the body of Beelze, but his two head resembles to that of Red-Eyes Black Dragon.

REDD: 4000 ATK

“What in the?” Sayer said in absolute confusion.

“He did it. My brother actually did it.” You said in shock.

“He really did.” Akiza said too.

“Get ready, Sayer. This new dragon is going to put you in your place.” Ren said with defiance.

“Please. He maybe stronger, but he only has four thousand attack points. Even if he destroys my Ultimate Axon Kicker, I’ll only take one hundred points of damage.” Sayer said not concern at all about Ren’s new monster.

“Not quite.” Ren said.

“What do you mean not quite?” Sayer wondered.

“I mean that he’s going to finish you off this turn. With his effect, he can destroy one of your monsters and deal you half of it’s attack points as damage.” Ren said.

“Have you forgotten about something? My Axon Kicker can’t be destroyed by your card effects.” Sayer reminded Ren.

“I know that. That’s why I play the spell, Forbidden Chalice. It’ll give your Ultimate Axon Kicker four hundred points, but it’ll also negate his effects until the end of the turn. But that won’t last long, will it?” Ren said.

UAK: 4300 ATK

“It can’t be!” Sayer said in shock.

“It can, Sayer. It can. Now destroy his Axon Kicker.” Ren commanded as Sayer’s synchro got burned to ash.

Sayer: 1850

“Now that burns.” Akiza said as you agreed.

“Luckily for you, my dragon can’t attack on the turn I activate his ability.” Ren said.

“That’s too bad. I still have life points left. So much for your big finish.” Sayer said still cocky.

“Think again. I now play the spell, De-Fusion. I now split my dragon back into the two I used to summon him.” Ren said as Beelze and Red-Eyes are back.

BotDD: 3000 ATK

REBD: 2400 ATK

“This is impossible! I couldn’t lose! Not to you of all people!” Sayer said knowing that it’s over.

“Hey, here’s the thing, Sayer. Like you, life’s a bitch. Beelze and Red-Eyes, attack Sayer directly and end this duel.” Ren declared as both dragons blasted Sayer back.

Sayer: 0
1311111111111111111111112111211221111111.title: Transcendence

1311111111111111111111112111211221111111.content:
"AAAAAAAHHHHHH!!!!" Sayer yells out as the force of the blast launches him into a nearby wall. The duel ends and the holograms fade as you and Akiza run up to hug Ren.

"Good work bro." You say.

"Yeah. That was amazing." Akiza cheers. "And what's more, you finally unlocked your card."

"Yeah." Ren says as he looks down at his new fusion monster. "Looks like we're all ready to do this thing in the tournament." He says.

"Yeah. But first..." You say as you draw everyone's attention to Sayer, who has now gotten up to his knees. "It's over Sayer. No doubt by now Security is already on it's way here to take you back to the facility. You've lost. The Movement is still mine to lead."

"N-no." He groans. "I won't let it end like this. I won't!" He yells as he slaps a card on his duel disk. A fireball appears above his head. "I don't care if I lost. If you die, the new Movement dies with you. Then I can pick up the pieces. Now DIE!!!" He yells as the fireball is launched at all of you.

"Azure-Eyes, help us out!" You say as you throw your monster down on your duel disk. You monster appears and emits a barrier around all of you, stopping the fireball and reflecting it back at Sayer. He could barely react as his own attack hits him and he drops to the floor.

You release Azure-Eyes as you all head over to his body. "Is he...?" Akiza asks.
1311111111111111111111112111211221111111.title: A Sore Loser

1311111111111111111111112111211221111111.content:
You went up to Sayer and checked his pulse. You can still feel the beating proving he’s still alive.

“He’s alive, but I think he’s in a coma. It’ll be a while before he wakes up again.” You said.

“I know this sounds rude and wrong, but do you think it best if we... “finish the job”?” Ren wondered.

“No. Sayer maybe evil, but death is never the answer. Besides, it’s best for him to live with his sins and crimes as long at it takes.” You said.

“We understand.” Akiza said.

“Did we miss the show?”

You all turned to see Yusei, Jack, Crow, Trudge, Mina, and Security coming from behind you as well as the twins.

“Leo! Luna!” Ren said as the twins went to hug him.

“Ren! You saved us!” Luna said happily.

“Yeah! You were awesome!” Leo said too as they let Ren go.

“I’ll be taking him back to prison. He’ll be well kept nice and cozy back there for a long time.” Trudge said picking the unconscious Sayer on his shoulder.

You then see Ren looking at Sayer’s deck and spots Thought Ruler Archfiend.

“I think this monster would be a very good addition to my deck.” Ren said as he looks at the card.
